Class PostfixEvaluator

  • java.lang.Object
    • PostfixEvaluator

  • public class PostfixEvaluator
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for evaluating integer arithmetic expressions in postfix or "reverse Polish" notation.
    Author:
    agoettler

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.Stack<java.lang.Integer> operandStack
      A stack used for performing the postfix evaluation.

    • Method Detail

      • evaluatePostfixExpression

        public int evaluatePostfixExpression(java.lang.StringBuffer expression)
        This method evaluates an integer arithmetic expression in postfix notation. Expressions must be in the format " operandB operandA operator". Expressions can only contain numerals, spaces and the characters "+", "-", "*", "/", "^", "%". Invalid characters and invalid operations such as division by zero will yield a result of zero accompanied by an exception and stack trace printed to System.err, and a warning message printed to System.out.
        Parameters:
        expression - A StringBuffer object representing the expression.
        Returns:
        The integer result of the evaluated expression.

      • calculate

        private int calculate(int operandA,
            java.lang.String operator,
            int operandB)
               throws java.lang.ArithmeticException
        This private helper method performs calculations for the evaluatePostfixExpression method. Invalid operations, such as division by zero, will cause an ArithmeticException to be thrown. Calculations are of the form: "operandA operator operandB"
        Parameters:
        operandA - The first operand.
        operator - The operation to be performed
        operandB - The second operand.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException

      • tokenizeExpression

        private java.lang.String[] tokenizeExpression(java.lang.String expression)
        This private helper method separates the expression into space-separated tokens to allow the evaluatePostFixExpression to process integer operands greater than 9.
        Parameters:
        expression - The expression to be tokenized.
        Returns:
        A String array of the tokens from the expressions.
